comments:
To test some animation software I'm writing, I have been downloading random
animated GIFs off the web. If I find ones that can be displayed in web browsers,
but generate exceptions in the SWT image loading routines, I'll attach them here.

Created an attachment (id=7010)
a problem GIF

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Invalid image
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2592)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2522)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.image.LZWCodec.decode(LZWCodec.java:60)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.image.LZWCodec.decode(LZWCodec.java:112)
	at
org.eclipse.swt.internal.image.GIFFileFormat.readImageBlock(GIFFileFormat.java:404)

	at
org.eclipse.swt.internal.image.GIFFileFormat.loadFromByteStream(GIFFileFormat.java:108)

	at
org.eclipse.swt.internal.image.FileFormat.loadFromStream(FileFormat.java:47)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.image.FileFormat.load(FileFormat.java:75)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.ImageLoader.load(ImageLoader.java:124)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.ImageLoader.load(ImageLoader.java:150)
	...

Created an attachment (id=7061)
A big JPEG

Causes an OOM error on both Win and Mac. All of the platform tools (image
viewer, web browsers, etc.) can load it without difficulty.

> 20051102

Fixed GIF in comment 1 as follows:
- Fixed decoding to allow unknown codes - tested on all my GIFs and all work.
- Fixed transparency problem where a previous workaround did not take local 
palettes into account.

Will have a look at JPG in comment 2 tomorrow.

Fixed > 20051103.
Was failing on the last big alloc. Freed up a bunch of memory that was no 
longer being used, and that last request for memory now goes through.
